questions.question: We may play football. It depends ......................... the weather.
questions.description: Depend and dependent take the preposition 'on'.

questions.question: We want to see a big increase .................... productivity.
questions.description: Increase is followed by 'in', not 'of' or 'with'

questions.question: Excuse me, sir. You haven't ............................ your drink.
questions.description: We pay 'for' something that is bought.

questions.question: His wife is suffering .............................. hepatitis.
questions.description: Suffer is followed by the preposition 'from'.

questions.question: I hate the thought .......................... going back to work.
questions.description: The correct expression is 'the thought of'.

questions.question: I am sorry ............................. breaking your window.
questions.description: Sorry can be followed by for or about.

questions.question: Who is responsible ............................. the shopping this week?
questions.description: The words responsible and responsibility are followed by 'for'.

questions.question: You remind me ............................ a boy I was at school with.
questions.description: We use remind...of to say that something makes us remember the past.

questions.question: I am pleased ........................... my exam results.
questions.description: We can be pleased with / about / at something, but we can only be pleased with somebody.

questions.question: The noise from upstairs prevented me .........................
questions.description: Note the pattern: prevent ... from ... ing form.

questions.question: She insisted ........................... paying for the drinks.
I am having difficulty .......................... my visa processing.
questions.description: We can have difficulty with something and difficulty in doing something.
